content:
Diagnosis:

Combined small cell lung carcinoma, T3N2M1c
Diagnosed March 2024
DLL3 high expression, ASCL1 positive
Widespread metastatic disease affecting liver, bone, and adrenal glands

Previous medical history:
COPD with frequent exacerbations
Type 2 diabetes
Hypertension

Current medications:
Morphine sulfate MR 30mg BD
Oxycodone 5mg PRN
Dexamethasone 4mg OD
Metformin 1g BD
Ramipril 5mg OD

Treatment summary:
Cycle 1-4 Carboplatin/Etoposide completed April 2024
Palliative radiotherapy to T8 vertebra 20Gy in 5# completed March 2024

Current situation:
Significant disease progression on CT 15 May 2024 with new liver lesions and increasing size of primary tumor. Performance status deteriorated to ECOG 3.

I reviewed [redacted name] today who attended with his wife. Unfortunately, he has experienced significant clinical deterioration over the past three weeks. His mobility has declined substantially, and he now requires wheelchair assistance. He reports worsening right-sided chest pain and increasing breathlessness at rest, requiring oxygen support at 3L/min. His appetite has significantly decreased with associated weight loss of 6kg over the past month.

On examination, there is dullness to percussion and reduced air entry in the right hemithorax. There is tender hepatomegaly extending 4cm below the costal margin. Performance status has declined to ECOG 3.

Given the clear evidence of disease progression and declining performance status, we have had a detailed discussion about prognosis and future care planning. While second-line chemotherapy with topotecan was considered, his current performance status makes this unsuitable. We have agreed to focus on symptom management and quality of life.

I have referred [redacted name] to our palliative care team for ongoing support and symptom management. We have increased his background morphine dose and provided additional breakthrough medication. I have also arranged for urgent community support through our palliative care coordinator.

We will continue to provide support through our specialist nursing team, and I have given clear instructions about contacting our acute oncology service if needed. [redacted name] and his wife understand the situation and have expressed a preference for home-based care where possible.
